Key Arguments: Misinformation and disinformation are dangerous and need to be addressed.
The far right spreads falsehoods that mislead people.
Misinformation about autism, particularly regarding its causes and association with vaccines, needs to be stopped.
Vaccine misinformation poses a serious health threat and undermines public trust.
COVID-19 misinformation has contributed to the spread of the disease and defiance of health orders.
Political misinformation, especially from right-leaning media, undermines fair elections.
The legislation should not give ACMA direct authority to remove content but should ensure providers uphold standards.
Main Themes: Role of ACMA and content regulation
Notable Quotes: Misinformation and disinformation clouds people's ability to judge what they see online, or even in print media.
Vaccines are safe and effective when used correctly.
This legislation is a massive step in the right direction.
Back it up, or shut up.
